intro: Hedeoma pulcherrima, commonly known as the Mexican heather or redstem filaree, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family, which includes many species with showy, often colorful flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is characterized by its branched, upright stems and clusters of small, red or pink flowers. Its foliage is usually gray-green, with leaves that are narrow and slightly hairy. Hedeoma pulcherrima is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
